intro: Crypsinus dekockii, commonly known as the Cape snowflake, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens.
